definition: you don't release the hawk until you've seen the hare (idiom)/one doesn't act before one is sure to succeed
pinyin: bu4 jian4 tu4 zi5 bu4 sa1 ying1

definition: to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
to let go/to cast/to let loose/to discharge/to give expression to
use a long line to catch a big fish (idiom); a long-term plan for major returns
pinyin: fang4 chang2 xian4 diao4 da4 yu2

definition: to quit while one is ahead (idiom)/to know when to stop
lit. not to shed a tear until one sees the coffin (idiom)/fig. refuse to be convinced until one is faced with grim reality
pinyin: bu4 jian4 guan1 cai5 bu4 luo4 lei4

definition: variant of 老奸巨猾[lao3 jian1 ju4 hua2]
to open one's eyes wide at the sight of profit (idiom); thinking of nothing but personal gain/money-grubbing
rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect
lit. see the wind and set the helm (idiom); fig. to act pragmatically/to be flexible and take advantage of the situation
one who is not prepared to risk his child will never catch the wolf (proverb)/(fig.) one who is unwilling to take risks will not achieve great things
pinyin: she3 bu4 de5 hai2 zi5 tao4 bu4 zhu4 lang2

definition: to lie in wait/to ambush/to conceal sth
